Title: 3. News Media
Write-Up Text: Questions around the budgets impact of inflation are front and centre ahead of Opposition Leader Peter Dutton's address to parliament this evening. The government has won support from the Greens and some crossbench MPs for its latest welfare increases but looks set to face ongoing debate over resource taxes and housing. The business community has praised funding for the hydrogen sector but called for more investment in critical minerals infrastructure science and technology. Inner-city doctors have also said while changes to bulk-billing systems are welcome they unlikely to make dramatic changes in the short term to how clinics operate.
